newsitem.title: UK: Ramco looks for more Caspian projects.
newsitem.headline: Ramco looks for more Caspian projects.

text.p: Ramco Energy, the oil minnow which teamed up with Mobil and Total to develop a new Azeri area, said it continued to look for other exploration projects to raise its interests near the Caspian Sea.
"We are looking at other things, both in Azerbaijan and in other areas in the Caspian region," finance director Steven Bertram told Reuters.
"But we don't have anything in the pipeline at the moment," he added.
Bertram declined to give the location of the new Azeri area Ramco plans to develop with Mobil and Total.
The location will only be unveiled once exploration licences have been obtained, Bertram said.
"We don't have the licences at the moment and drawing attention to this particular area is going to attract other companies to compete for it," he said.

The new on- and offshore area is Ramco's third project in Azerbaijan. It has a 2.1 percent stake in an international consortium which develops three enormous offshore fields, while it also plans to develop the big onshore Muradhani field together with the State Oil Company of the Azerbaijan Republic.
News of the deal with Mobil and Total send Ramco shares 31-1/2 pence higher to 660.
